name: places/ChIJpWkDZbNZwokRd0vEsmrQIWs
formattedAddress: 116 Loisaida Ave, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 116 Loisaida Ave, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text: A fun place to grab a drink or go dancing later in the evening. Very nice decorations and they don’t let it get too overcrowded. I’d come back!

text.text: A fun place to grab a drink or go dancing later in the evening. Very nice decorations and they don’t let it get too overcrowded. I’d come back!

originalText.text: I’m baffled at the racism I experienced here. As someone who works in the service industry, I’m extremely disappointed in the management of this place. It’s disheartening to see their employees being unapologetically hostile and rude towards POC. Please do not come here if you are a POC and are looking for a safe and welcoming space to go with your friends. I see other reviews on here that express similar concerns and the ambivalence towards casual racism should not be supported by its patrons. I’m begging the management to re evaluate their values.

text.text: I’m baffled at the racism I experienced here. As someone who works in the service industry, I’m extremely disappointed in the management of this place. originalText.text:
As an Alphabet City resident, Ding-A-Ling absolutely has my heart.

There is no better place to step out on a Friday/Saturday night.

Ding-A-Ling has reached a goldilocks scenario of the amount of people they let into the bar at one time. It is just enough where it is ACTIVE and there are a good amount of people in there, but it is not too crowded to the point where you are sweating, have to fight for your life to get to the bar, can't move, etc. It's ideal.

The Music selection is also perfectly curated. They play songs you haven't heard in forever, but you will know some words so you can sing along and look cool. hahaaahahahaha. It's a great dopamine hit.

Ding has also perfected the music volume levels. You can vibe out to songs for sure, but not so loud where you have to yell at someone to have a conversation.

Also I need to shoutout Ernesto who works the door. I imagine it's such a thankless job but he does great at it and almost always has a smile on his face. Great energy from him always! Y'all need to be nicer to bouncers smh.

Also I'm seeing a lot of reviews that this place is racist. I can only give my first hand experience:

My roommate, a black man, and I, a proud latino, have been met with nothing but open arms whenever we have been here.

CANT RECOMMEND IT ENOUGH!

originalText.text: Crazy place charging $20 drinks with rats running across the floor. Literally had one touch my leg…. So disgusting I hope they clean up the place

text.text: Crazy place charging $20 drinks with rats running across the floor. Literally had one touch my leg…. So disgusting I hope they clean up the place

originalText.text: I ordered a drink at the bar and was provided an iPad to tap pay with my iPhone. After leaving a tip the bartender started to shame me for a leaving a low tip and instead of giving me a drink I paid for he gave me a glass of 1 ice cube. After that the bartender refused to talk to me.
